Posts.Content: Apr 23, 2014 09:01PM morningcoffee wrote: Hi Ladies, Thanks so much for your responses so far! This is extremely helpful. I forgot to mention my tumor is about 4.5, so maybe I'm over the limit to qualify for RFA? For SBRT, I was told that 5 cm is usually the cutoff. Sounds like RFA, in general, is effective. I will be sure to ask a lot of questions when I have my RFA consult.  Also, I will definitely contact Coolbreeze to ask about her experience with SBRT.   Thanks so much for letting me know about the "Search" tool - this should be very helpful. I am new to this site as well as technologically challenged. :)
Posts.Title: Options for Liver Mets - RFA vs. SBRT morningcoffee tcallegan

Posts.Content: Apr 23, 2014 09:56PM morningcoffee wrote: Thank you cheery! This is very helpful. Just wondering, did you end up doing either procedure?
Posts.Title: Options for Liver Mets - RFA vs. SBRT morningcoffee tcallegan

Posts.Content: Apr 25, 2014 01:03AM morningcoffee wrote: Okay, thanks for letting me know.  Glad to hear your scans have been good so far. It's encouraging to know that SBRT has been well studied and that people seem to be doing well for 2 years and even beyond. Amazing to hear that the outliers have lived 7 years and beyond without recurrence.
